AcceleratorCount.description: The minimum and maximum number of accelerators (GPUs, FPGAs, or AWS Inferential chips) on an instance.

AcceleratorTotalMemoryMiB.description: The minimum and maximum amount of total accelerator memory, in MiB.

Max.description: The maximum amount of accelerator memory, in MiB.

Min.description: The minimum amount of accelerator memory, in MiB.

BaselineEbsBandwidthMbps.description: The minimum and maximum baseline bandwidth to Amazon EBS, in Mbps.

Max.description: The maximum baseline bandwidth, in Mbps.

Min.description: The minimum baseline bandwidth, in Mbps.

BlockDeviceMapping.description: Information about a block device mapping for an Amazon EC2 launch template.

DeviceName.description: The user data to make available to the instance.

NoDevice.description: To omit the device from the block device mapping, specify an empty string.

CapacityReservationSpecification.description: Specifies an instance's Capacity Reservation targeting option.

CapacityReservationPreference.description: Indicates the instance's Capacity Reservation preferences.

CapacityReservationId.description: The ID of the Capacity Reservation in which to run the instance.

CapacityReservationResourceGroupArn.description: The ARN of the Capacity Reservation resource group in which to run the instance.

ConnectionTrackingSpecification.description: Allows customer to specify Connection Tracking options

TcpEstablishedTimeout.description: Integer value for TCP Established Timeout

UdpStreamTimeout.description: Integer value for UDP Stream Timeout

CpuOptions.description: specifies the CPU options for an instance.

AmdSevSnp.description: Indicates whether to enable the instance for AMD SEV-SNP. AMD SEV-SNP is supported with M6a, R6a, and C6a instance types only.

CoreCount.description: The number of CPU cores for the instance.

ThreadsPerCore.description: The number of threads per CPU core. To disable multithreading for the instance, specify a value of 1. Otherwise, specify the default value of 2.

CreditSpecification.description: The user data to make available to the instance.

CpuCredits.description: The user data to make available to the instance.

Ebs.description: Parameters for a block device for an EBS volume in an Amazon EC2 launch template.

DeleteOnTermination.description: Indicates whether the EBS volume is deleted on instance termination.

Encrypted.description: Indicates whether the EBS volume is encrypted. Encrypted volumes can only be attached to instances that support Amazon EBS encryption. If you are creating a volume from a snapshot, you can't specify an encryption value.

Iops.description: The number of I/O operations per second (IOPS).

KmsKeyId.description: The ARN of the symmetric AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) CMK used for encryption.

Throughput.description: The throughput to provision for a gp3 volume, with a maximum of 1,000 MiB/s.

VolumeSize.description: The size of the volume, in GiBs. You must specify either a snapshot ID or a volume size.

ElasticGpuSpecification.description: Specifies a specification for an Elastic GPU for launch template.

Type.description: The type of Elastic Graphics accelerator.

EnaSrdSpecification.description: Allows customer to specify ENA-SRD options

EnaSrdUdpSpecification.description: Allows customer to specify ENA-SRD (UDP) options

EnclaveOptions.description: Indicates whether the instance is enabled for AWS Nitro Enclaves.

Enabled.description: If this parameter is set to true, the instance is enabled for AWS Nitro Enclaves; otherwise, it is not enabled for AWS Nitro Enclaves.

HibernationOptions.description: Specifies whether your instance is configured for hibernation.

Configured.description: TIf you set this parameter to true, the instance is enabled for hibernation.

IamInstanceProfile.description: Specifies an IAM instance profile, which is a container for an IAM role for your instance.

Arn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the instance profile.

Name.description: The name of the instance profile.

InstanceMarketOptions.description: The market (purchasing) option for the instances.

InstanceRequirements.description: The attributes for the instance types.

AcceleratorManufacturers.description: Indicates whether instance types must have accelerators by specific manufacturers.

AcceleratorNames.description: The accelerators that must be on the instance type.

AcceleratorTypes.description: The accelerator types that must be on the instance type.

AllowedInstanceTypes.description: The instance types to apply your specified attributes against.

BareMetal.description: Indicates whether bare metal instance types must be included, excluded, or required.

items.description: The user data to make available to the instance.

InstanceGenerations.description: Indicates whether current or previous generation instance types are included.

LocalStorage.description: The user data to make available to the instance.

LocalStorageTypes.description: The type of local storage that is required.

OnDemandMaxPricePercentageOverLowestPric.description: The price protection threshold for On-Demand Instances.

RequireHibernateSupport.description: Indicates whether instance types must support hibernation for On-Demand Instances.

SpotMaxPricePercentageOverLowestPrice.description: The price protection threshold for Spot Instances.

Ipv4PrefixSpecification.description: Specifies an IPv4 prefix for a network interface.

Ipv6PrefixSpecification.description: Specifies an IPv6 prefix for a network interface.

LaunchTemplateData.description: The information for the launch template.

DisableApiStop.description: Indicates whether to enable the instance for stop protection.

DisableApiTermination.description: If you set this parameter to true, you can't terminate the instance using the Amazon EC2 console, CLI, or API.

EbsOptimized.description: Indicates whether the instance is optimized for Amazon EBS I/O.

ElasticGpuSpecifications.description: An elastic GPU to associate with the instance.

ElasticInferenceAccelerators.description: The elastic inference accelerator for the instance.

ImageId.description: The ID of the AMI. Alternatively, you can specify a Systems Manager parameter, which will resolve to an AMI ID on launch.

InstanceInitiatedShutdownBehavior.description: Indicates whether an instance stops or terminates when you initiate shutdown from the instance (using the operating system command for system shutdown).

KeyName.description: The name of the EC2 key pair

NetworkInterfaces.description: If you specify a network interface, you must specify any security groups and subnets as part of the network interface.

SecurityGroupIds.description: One or more security group IDs.

SecurityGroups.description: One or more security group names.

TagSpecifications.description: The tags to apply to the resources that are created during instance launch.

UserData.description: The user data to make available to the instance.

Count.description: The number of elastic inference accelerators to attach to the instance.

Type.description: The type of elastic inference accelerator.

LaunchTemplateTagSpecification.description: Specifies the tags to apply to the launch template during creation.

ResourceType.description: The type of resource to tag.

LicenseSpecification.description: Specifies a license configuration for an instance.

LicenseConfigurationArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the license configuration.

MaintenanceOptions.description: The maintenance options of your instance.

AutoRecovery.description: Disables the automatic recovery behavior of your instance or sets it to default.

RebootMigration.description: Disables the automatic reboot-migration behavior of your instance or sets it to default.

MemoryGiBPerVCpu.description: The minimum and maximum amount of memory per vCPU, in GiB.

Max.description: The maximum amount of memory per vCPU, in GiB.

Min.description: TThe minimum amount of memory per vCPU, in GiB.

MemoryMiB.description: The minimum and maximum amount of memory, in MiB.

Max.description: The maximum amount of memory, in MiB.

Min.description: The minimum amount of memory, in MiB.

MetadataOptions.description: The metadata options for the instance.

HttpEndpoint.description: Enables or disables the HTTP metadata endpoint on your instances. If the parameter is not specified, the default state is enabled.

HttpProtocolIpv6.description: Enables or disables the IPv6 endpoint for the instance metadata service.

HttpPutResponseHopLimit.description: The desired HTTP PUT response hop limit for instance metadata requests. The larger the number, the further instance metadata requests can travel.

InstanceMetadataTags.description: Set to enabled to allow access to instance tags from the instance metadata.

Monitoring.description: Specifies whether detailed monitoring is enabled for an instance.

Enabled.description: Specify true to enable detailed monitoring.

NetworkBandwidthGbps.description: The minimum and maximum amount of network bandwidth, in gigabits per second (Gbps).

Max.description: The maximum amount of network bandwidth, in Gbps.

Min.description: The minimum amount of network bandwidth, in Gbps.

NetworkInterface.description: Specifies the parameters for a network interface.

AssociateCarrierIpAddress.description: Indicates whether to associate a Carrier IP address with eth0 for a new network interface.

AssociatePublicIpAddress.description: Associates a public IPv4 address with eth0 for a new network interface.

DeleteOnTermination.description: Indicates whether the network interface is deleted when the instance is terminated.

Description.description: A description for the network interface.

DeviceIndex.description: The device index for the network interface attachment.

Groups.description: The IDs of one or more security groups.

Ipv4PrefixCount.description: The number of IPv4 prefixes to be automatically assigned to the network interface.

Ipv4Prefixes.description: One or more IPv4 prefixes to be assigned to the network interface.

Ipv6AddressCount.description: The number of IPv6 addresses to assign to a network interface.

Ipv6Addresses.description: One or more specific IPv6 addresses from the IPv6 CIDR block range of your subnet.

Ipv6PrefixCount.description: The number of IPv6 prefixes to be automatically assigned to the network interface.

Ipv6Prefixes.description: One or more IPv6 prefixes to be assigned to the network interface.

NetworkCardIndex.description: The index of the network card.

NetworkInterfaceId.description: The ID of the network interface.

PrimaryIpv6.description: Enables the first IPv6 global unique address (GUA) on a dual stack or IPv6-only ENI immutable.

PrivateIpAddress.description: The primary private IPv4 address of the network interface.

PrivateIpAddresses.description: One or more private IPv4 addresses.

SecondaryPrivateIpAddressCount.description: The number of secondary private IPv4 addresses to assign to a network interface.

SubnetId.description: The ID of the subnet for the network interface.

NetworkInterfaceCount.description: TThe minimum and maximum number of network interfaces.

Placement.description: Specifies the placement of an instance.

Affinity.description: The affinity setting for an instance on a Dedicated Host.

AvailabilityZone.description: The Availability Zone for the instance.

GroupId.description: The Group Id of a placement group. You must specify the Placement Group Group Id to launch an instance in a shared placement group.

GroupName.description: The name of the placement group for the instance.

HostId.description: The ID of the Dedicated Host for the instance.

HostResourceGroupArn.description: The ARN of the host resource group in which to launch the instances. If you specify a host resource group ARN, omit the Tenancy parameter or set it to host.

PartitionNumber.description: The number of the partition the instance should launch in. Valid only if the placement group strategy is set to partition.

Tenancy.description: The tenancy of the instance (if the instance is running in a VPC). An instance with a tenancy of dedicated runs on single-tenant hardware.

PrivateDnsNameOptions.description: Describes the options for instance hostnames.

EnableResourceNameDnsAAAARecord.description: Indicates whether to respond to DNS queries for instance hostnames with DNS AAAA records.

EnableResourceNameDnsARecord.description: Indicates whether to respond to DNS queries for instance hostnames with DNS A records.

HostnameType.description: The type of hostname for EC2 instances.

PrivateIpAdd.description: Specifies a secondary private IPv4 address for a network interface.

Primary.description: Indicates whether the private IPv4 address is the primary private IPv4 address. Only one IPv4 address can be designated as primary.

InstanceInterruptionBehavior.description: The behavior when a Spot Instance is interrupted. The default is terminate.

MaxPrice.description: The maximum hourly price you're willing to pay for the Spot Instances.

ValidUntil.description: The end date of the request, in UTC format (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ). Supported only for persistent requests.

Tag.description: The user data to make available to the instance.

TagSpecification.description: Specifies the tags to apply to a resource when the resource is created for the launch template.

ResourceType.description: The type of resource to tag.

TotalLocalStorageGB.description: The minimum and maximum amount of total local storage, in GB.

VCpuCount.description: The minimum and maximum number of vCPUs.

DefaultVersionNumber.description: The default version of the launch template

LatestVersionNumber.description: The latest version of the launch template

LaunchTemplateName.description: A name for the launch template.

TagSpecifications.description: The tags to apply to the launch template on creation.

VersionDescription.description: A description for the first version of the launch template.
